headline: Indian Chicken Curry (Murgh Kari)
description: In this easy Indian chicken curry chicken breasts are slowly simmered in a spicy curry sauce with yogurt, tomatoes, onion, garlic, and ginger.

video.description: The recipe in this video is a really good method to prepare spicy Indian chicken curry. It's pretty easy to make and tastes really good! Serve this dish over basmati rice for an easy meal.
video.name: How to Make Indian Chicken Curry

name: Indian Chicken Curry (Murgh Kari)
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle the chicken breasts with 2 teaspoons salt.
Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat; partially cook the chicken in the hot oil in batches until completely browned on all sides. Transfer browned chicken breasts to a plate and set aside.

Reduce the heat to medium and add onion, garlic, and ginger to the oil remaining in the skillet. Cook and stir until onion turns soft and translucent, 5 to 8 minutes. Stir curry powder, cumin, turmeric, coriander, cayenne, and 1 tablespoon of water into the onion mixture; allow to heat together for about 1 minute while stirring.
Add tomatoes, yogurt, 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro, and 1 teaspoon salt to the mixture; stir to combine.

Return chicken breast to the skillet along with any juices on the plate. Pour in 1/2 cup water and bring to a boil, turning the chicken to coat with the sauce. Sprinkle garam masala and 1 tablespoon cilantro over the chicken.

Cover the skillet and simmer until chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Drizzle with lemon juice to serve.

review.reviewBody: Curry powder has all the other spices that this recipe calls for.

I added less than 1 tsp of cayenne pepper so that my toddler could eat this without crying about spice. I also didn't add any lemon as I didn't want the yogurt base to curdle. The dish turned out amazing. My husband loved it and my toddler ate the entire plate. I am Indian and this dish tasted close to my moms cooking.
Used chicken thighs instead. And put spinach in at the end. Delicious.
I would add less water
Easy to fallow and it came out really tasty. Additionally I added some coconut milk, just love the taste of it.

The yogurt curdled a bit…but didn’t affect the flavor. May try using heavy cream or coconut milk next time. I made this exactly as written, zero deviations. Needs some naan for next time!! Very tasty!

So many huge issues. The yogurt is incorporated way too early and ended up curdling, it's overall too thin with absolutely no creaminess to it, the spice mixture is awful–all spice and bitterness and no rich flavor to back it up. Save yourself the heartbreak and DO NOT make this recipe.
I took advice on coconut milk instead of yogurt. It was truly amazing.

Made exactly as described, and I wish I had read more of the negative reviews before attempting because YES there are a lot of issues here. The yogurt breaks instead of becoming creamy, it’s overall too watery, and there is way too much cayenne. I actually LOVE spicy food but this is a case where spicy proportions are off. People who had success with this recipe generally made a lot of alterations…
Absolutely love this recipe! I forgot to add the lemon juice at the end but it was still delicious. Thank you.
Delicious and easy.
It was fairly easy. I did cut back on the cayenne.

I love this recipe!!! This curry is a staple iny home and I have cooked it soooo many times for my family. The only differences I make in my recipe are that I dice my chicken, I do not add the extra water, I use coconut milk instead of yogurt, and I add diced green chiles. I also use about half the cayenne pepper called for because I cook for little ones. Tonight I didn't have tumeric and subbed that with smoked paprika and it still came out super delicious!!

Right off the hop I know I wouldn’t care for this since it uses chicken breast. I, however shall try it with dark meat (legs and thighs), which is way more flavourful and also avoid adding yogurt a lot seems to be commenting on and use coconut milk or cream instead.
To the User who does not know what Cilantro is. It is Coriander. Lol.
I used coconut milk instead of yogurt because of a dairy allergy. Delicious. Kids loved it!

Lovely taste but I would strongly recommend adding flour after adding the spices, as it will turn out extremely watery. I followed the recipe to the note and it was very watery, had to add cornflour just to give it a little thickness.

My husband and I loved this recipe. I cut out the yogurt, used 1/8 teaspoon of cayenne pepper and served it with STEAMER MANGO RICE and asparagus, it was divine. Next time, I will try it with yogurt and hope it is as good.
Best in the biz. Looks lovely keep up the effort.
2 teaspoons of salt ruined the dish...1 would be better...everything else was perfect
Not bad but probably won't make again. Some liked it; others did not.
Delish! My kids are vegetarian and so I didn't use meat at all. It was still very good. Maybe I'll try tofu at some point. I served it with frozen mixed vegetables and rice.

Still on the quest of the best curry ever, and that one was great! Only alteration I did to the recipe is to reduce the amount of Cayenne to 1/4 Tsp to make it untrained family friendly. Will make again.
We didn't have cilantro so I threw in coriander and used old homemade curry powder and the dish was delicious. This recipe is adaptable and good.

Tasty dish! Cooked as per the instructions but substituted dairy yogurt for coconut yogurt. Rested the breasts after cooking and sliced them up - super tender. Also added a cornstarch slurry to thicken the sauce a bit.

I'm sorry but I have followed the exact recipe above and this curry is completely inedible. As mentioned by others - the yoghurt has curdled after being brought to a boil. I have made many curries (using authentic recipe books) and never has this ever happened. Most often the yoghurt is added at the end and only stirred in and heated for a short period of time. It's watery, curdled, inedible and quite frankly disgusting. It's going straight in the bin - what a waste of chicken!

I've made this exact recipe (perhaps adding some additional veggies) about 30 times in the last few years. It lasts for a few days, and everyone is always complimenting the flavor. This is my goto, quick dish. I'm going to try making butter chicken next!

I followed this recipe to the tee. The sauce broke, and was very bitter as another person mentioned. I have to say it was horrible and I had to throw it out. What did I do wrong,? Have made many curries in my life but this was totally unedible.
simple and excellent. my husband loved it. i will definitely be making again!
Absolutely loved it! Amazing flavor, yum!
Loved it !
Best curry I have ever tasted, thank you for sharing!
I made it and it is good but I doubled and even tripled some of the spices. If I had not, this may have been a little bland. Not much difference between this and Tikka Masala to my family.
shashank Star-73 testing Adding a photo editing a photo
AMAZING REAL AUTHENTIC FLAVORS!! I chose to cut chicken breast after cooking into 2 inch chunks before adding all the delicious spices!! DELISH !! SMELLS +++ YUM !

Definitely don't use a half cup of oil. Had a rough start because I used a quarter cup of olive oil on high heat and it was... not fun. The oil was smoking because it was olive oil of course, and it was splattering everywhere... I stopped everything, removed the chicken, dumped the oil, and replaced it with canola oil. Canola oil has a higher smoke point, so this was fine. The chicken refused to brown until I removed almost all but a tablespoon. I felt a little foolish, it's obvious that the video shows them using a tablespoon of oil even while clearly stating a half cup. Shame on staff for changing the recipe for the video but keeping the same written directions. -1 star. The other issue was that my sauce broke for some reason. I've got little grains of yogurt floating around in the sauce and it looks awful. I only added a quarter cup of water instead of a half cup after the yogurt and the tomatoes, so maybe that was the problem? I think next time I might pre-mix the yogurt and the water and add it right at the end. I also added two fresh serrano peppers instead of using cayenne and it's got a nice medium heat.
I made this last night and we loved it! I added chicken thighs (diced up), peas, diced tomatoes, carrots and French cut green beans, then put it over basmati rice. One of our new favorite dishes!

Absolutely delicious! Spicey enough to qualify as authentic but not too hot. I cube the chicken breast before cooking as it is easier to serve over basmati rice. I use no salt added tomatoes and no salt added chicken broth in place of water. Do measure your spices before cooking!
Fun to make
It is super yummy, easy, and can be made with dairy free almond yogurt for sure! I will never buy pre-made curry again. I love this d-f, gluten-free dish so much, definitely will make again!

Love, Love Love..if you are not into Indian spices..stop now..if you are, then embrace this tasty dish. I did cut down the oil and the cayenne, but other than that and using thighs, I followed the recipe..go for it and enjoy.

I liked the recipe however it was a bit too acidic. I also reduced the amount of tomato to get a bit less sauce. It is a work in progress though. I would make this again but still would reduce a bit more the amount of sauce. I know Indian food does not call for sugar but given the need to balance the acid of the recipe, I might add it next time.
This recipe is excellent, I had a friend that requested that I make this and Allrecipes never let's me down. He loved it and so did I but it's super spicy for me lol. I would make it again though!
I made this exactly according to the directions. It was absolutely fabulous! I used spicy curry instead of the regular curry. My 8 year old grandson was impressed.
Delicious!
Tasted as good as restaurant curry and healthier. Spice level is perfect.
Gg
Made this twice this week, amazing!! Second time i doubled everything and subbed coconut milk for the water. Served it with cilantro rice, perfection!!
Absolutely dilicious!!! You will be blown away by this curry. It is ridiculously good. I added a 1/8 teaspoon extra of cayenne and it gets the spice just right. Try this recipe, it is super easy!

Absolute perfection. Hits all of the markers for a perfect curry. So rich and flavorful! Just the right amount of heat. Thick sauce means is can be eaten on naan or rice. I added precooked potato and peas. Everyone LOVED this!!!!

made as described. everyone enjoyed it! will def make this again! yummy sauce- the chicken, i read the reviews and I cut it up after i browned it after it rested on the plate it was tender and juicy ! tasted better than take out
I cooked it to perfection!! Thank you!!
I prefer this to take out. I added peas and cauliflower and it was amazing. It was also great as left overs. Very happy with this recipe!
Really good! Wish I could give it 4.5 stars! Added a teaspoon of a tandoori spice. Even my kids ate it! About a 4 Spicey for me, about a 7 for the kids.
10/10 definitely making this a few times a month!
Excellent recipe

None of us liked it..I'm no picky eater and I've had indian food plenty of times. never had anything so bitter. Extremely bitter, really couldn't even eat it.. Tried to use lime to kill it, would have had to use a whole lime for a plate just to get through it. Ended up throwing it out. Definitely won't make this again, can't believe this is a 5 star recipe.

THIS is how I make my curry, glad to see a recipe using garam masala. Only 4 stars since I feel it needs more veggies. Towards the final 30 minutes I add some chunks of bell and sweet peppers and usually zucchini, although any squash should work .... even pumpkin. I also like to use some coconut milk too. Pineapple chunks and/or potato is another option for this. ;-)
I was looking for a new curry recipe as my grandsons had gotten bored with the main one I was making. We all absolutely love this one plus it's easy to cook. Win, win!

I made the recipe as/is except I only used 1 pound of chicken since it's just for me. It got pretty oily but maybe had I had 2 pounds of chicken it would have been less oily? I did something wrong because my spices ended up kind of separating. But it tasted DELICIOUS and I'll definitely make it again!
Amazing
I use this recipe many times. It is so simple, fast and easy to prepare. It also tastes delicious !!!! Thank you for the recipe and please visit us: https://www.beckandbulow.com
could be creamier but my family loves the flavor. i felt it could use a little more flavor but this is worth making again and tweaking to our taste. i added more cyanne.
I was heavy handed with the curry and garam masala and still felt it could have used more flavor. The base was all there, just needed an extra “umph” to put it over the edge.
Delicious.
Family loved this recipe the went back for seconds think next time ill try cubing the chicken (?)
This is an excellent recipe, the only change I made was to cut the chicken in large cubes. Otherwise made it 100% as the recipe.
This is now our favourite 'go to' curry. Quick and easy with a great flavour. I used a hot curry powder and chose to cut the chicken into bit size pieces, adjusted the cooking time to suit.
Love this recipe. I tried the recipe with coconut milk instead of yogurt and it is very good. I have also tried half yogurt and half coconut milk and this was very good also.
It was amazing and very easy to make so darn tasty
Subbed coconut milk for water, added sliced jalapeños & used scallions instead of sweet onions, cam out great
Excellent! I followed the recipe, except using thighs instead of breasts...it was perfect!
This honestly hits the spot for whenever i'm craving Indian curry! Everyone loved it when I made it for them.
Delicious! I cut up the chicken into cubes before cooking it, which the written recipe didn't say to do, but seems to be what most Indian restaurants do.
Followed almost exactly, I think the spice level is good considering it was labeled as spicy.

I loved it & so did my Texan Hubby, who had never tried curry before. It was so full of body in my mouth~!~ I didn't have turmeric so Alexa said I could use ground mustard, and it was awesome! I made mine with rice & roasted Brussel sprouts & yaupon potatoes & it was a delightful dinner!! Wouldn't change a thing!! THANKS so much!

I'm not a fan of hot curries, and this was almost too hot for me but my daughter gave it a 5/5 and I will definitely make it again.
I didn't change anything other than cut the huge chicken breasts in half.
It's good, try it !

An absolute treat. Nice touch of heat to a basic tomato-based curry. Was really easy to make. One thing I would suggest when making is to get some of the sauce into a bowl and add the yoghurt in first so it doesn't split. 

My other suggestion would be to make double the amount, this would go great day 2 or 3 when the flavours have had some time to mature. Will cook again.
This recipe tasted just like takeout from a restaurant! Highly recommend ?? If you like a little less spicy I used 1/2 - 3/4 a tsp of cayenne pepper. I also used basmati rice.
Made with diced breast and it was succulent.
This was tasty. Make sure you use whole milk yogurt or put it in at the end after it's cooled a bit. I accidentally used 2% and it curdled even on low heat.

Fantastic recipe. I substituted the yogurt and extra water with coconut milk and accidentally forgot the turmeric, but the dish was a hit with everyone (even the picky eaters). The recipe is also really easy to follow and is not very strict, so if you make a lot of errors or take forever like me, you can still make this.
My family loved this recipe. I followed the ingredients, perfect. No need for change

Love it!
 Absolutely delicious and authentic tasting. I used 1/4 tsp of cayenne instead of a full teaspoon, still flavorful and savory but with less heat!
I love this recipe. I stay true to it and I never change a thing. This is my favorite curry chicken one. Thank You!
FantaStic!!! I subbed tempeh in for chix, and added diced bell pepper and julienned carrot, and used a rather spicy curry, but it was heavenly!! I will add peas next time (soon!!)

Oh wow...this was AMAZING. Followed the recipe as written with the exception of adding some slivers of red pepper and reducing the cayenne to 1/2 tsp. We will most certainly make this again but next time will use less oil for browning. There was a lot left after browning the chicken but we went ahead and left it in there with the onion. This was incredibly flavorful and we are planning to eat it for breakfast. Can't wait. HIGHLY recommend this.

This was a great recipe. A few tweaks: replace water with chicken stock. Replace cayenne with Kashmir chili powder. Add 1/2 tsp of methi (fenugreek leaves). All these added depth. I served over brown basmati rice and home-made naan. A real crowdpleaser!
All I did was add a little brown sugar because I like my curry a bit sweeter. This is an excellent recipe on its own! Thank you!

Yummy, fairly easy to make, and the right level of spice for my family. The one thing I did differently was that I partially uncovered the pan because it was sputtering like crazy when it was totally covered. Everyone loved it and asked for more :)
This is easy to make and it tastes great! It's definitely a family favorite now.

I've been making curries for many years ( I'm no chef, trust me) and I can honestly say this is the best curry I've ever made. The whole family loved it.

I did make 1 small chnage as I find chicken breasts tend be dry. I used 2kgs of thighs (cut in half) instead.

There were times when I doubted the volume of the ingredients, especially the olive oil, but it turned out perfectly.
Thank you so much.
Alex from Australia

I love this recipe. I have been making it for the last 2 years. I make it true to the recipe and everyone should try that first. I finally created an account just now to tell you I love it. Thank you very much

Absolutely delicious recipe. It could've been spicier in my opinion, but that might be because of the spices I used or my inordinate liking for hot food. Although I've made this recipe three times, I have always substituted the turkey with chicken and cut it up into medium-sized squares, but otherwise I make it exactly as the recipe states. I also accompany it with rice. I'm sure with chicken it would be even better!

Use oil as needed not what is suggested by the recipe. I followed the recipe to a T and the reduction took 2 hours. This recipe is more sweet than spicy. This is the first recipe I have ever reviewed because I thought it was important enough to let people know this information.
Great recipe! Highly recommend using chicken thighs (chopped) instead of chicken breast. Served over basmati rice and garnished with a little extra cilantro. Must try.
Yum!
loved this curry one of the best I've made
great recipe! keeps a big tubby boy happy! Jake
